com.relteq.sirius.simulator
Class ObjectFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.relteq.sirius.simulator.ObjectFactory

public final class ObjectFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Factory methods for creating scenarios, controllers, events, sensors, and scenario elements.

Use the static methods in this class to load a scenario from XML, and to programmatically generate events, controllers, sensors, and scenario elements.

Method Detail

createAndLoadScenario

public static _Scenario createAndLoadScenario(java.lang.String configfilename,
                                              java.lang.String outputfileprefix,
                                              double timestart,
                                              double timeend,
                                              double outdt)
Loads and validates scenarios from XML.

This method does the following,

  1. Unmarshalls the configuration file to populate JAXB objects,
  2. Determines the simulation mode (see below),
  3. Registers controllers with their targets (calls to InterfaceController.register()),
  4. Validates the scenario and all its components (calls to validate() on all scenario components).

The simulation mode can be normal, warmup from initial condition, or warmup from zero density, depending on the values of timestart, timeend, and the time stamp on the initial density profile (time_ic). In the normal mode, the simulator initializes the network with densities provided in the initial density profile, and produces as output the evolution of the density state from timestart to timeend. The warmup modes are executed whenever timestart does not match the timestamp of the initial density profile. In these modes the objective is to generate a configuration file with an initial density profile corresponding to timestart. If timestart> time_ic, the network is initialized with the given initial density profile and run from time_ic to timestart. If timestart< time_ic, the simulation is is initialized with zero density and run from the earliest timestamp of all demand profiles (timestart_demand) to timestart, assuming timestart_demand<timestart. If timestart< time_ic and timestart_demand>timestart, an error is produced.

Simulation mode Condition Initial condition Start time End time Output
normal timestart==time_ic initial density profile timestart timeend state
warmup from ic timestart> time_ic initial density profile time_ic timestart configuration file
warmup from zero timestart< time_ic zero density timestart_demand timestart configuration file

Parameters:
configfilename - The name of the XML configuration file.
outputfileprefix - A prefix to be used for all simulation output files.
timestart - The start time of the simulation in seconds after midnight.
timeend - The end time of the simulation in seconds after midnight.
outdt - The period in seconds at which simulation output is written.
Returns:
scenario _Scenario object.

createController_IRM_Alinea

public static _Controller createController_IRM_Alinea(_Scenario myScenario,
                                                      _Link onramplink,
                                                      _Link mainlinelink,
                                                      _Sensor mainlinesensor,
                                                      _Sensor queuesensor,
                                                      double gain)
Alinea isolated ramp metering.

Generates a controller executing the Alinea algorithm. Feedback for the controller is taken either from mainlinelink or mainlinesensor, depending on which is specified. Hence exactly one of the two must be non-null. A queue override algorithm will be employed if the queuesensor is non-null. The gain, defined in mile/hr units, is normalized within the algorithm by dividing by the length a the mainline link (or by the link where the sensor resides in the case of sensor feedback).

Parameters:
myScenario - The scenario that contains the controller and its referenced links.
onramplink - The onramp link being controlled.
mainlinelink - The mainline link used for feedback (optional, use null to omit).
mainlinesensor - The onramp sensor used for feedback (optional, use null to omit).
queuesensor - The sensor on the onramp used to detect queue spillover optional, use null to omit).
gain - The gain for the integral controller in mile/hr.
Returns:
_Controller object

createEvent_Control_Toggle

public static _Event createEvent_Control_Toggle(_Scenario myScenario,
                                                float timestampinseconds,
                                                java.util.List<_Controller> controllers,
                                                boolean ison)
On/Off switch for controllers. Turns all controllers included in the controllers array on or off, depending on the value of ison, at time timestampinseconds. Here "off" means that the control commands are ignored by their targets, and that the controller's update function is not called.

Parameters:
myScenario - The scenario.
timestampinseconds - Activation time for the event.
controllers - List of target _Controller objects.
ison - true turns controllers on, false turns controllers off.
Returns:
_Event object

createEvent_Fundamental_Diagram

public static _Event createEvent_Fundamental_Diagram(_Scenario myScenario,
                                                     java.util.List<_Link> links,
                                                     double freeflowSpeed,
                                                     double congestionSpeed,
                                                     double capacity,
                                                     double densityJam,
                                                     double capacityDrop,
                                                     double stdDevCapacity)
Change the model parameters of a list of links.

Use this event to modify any subset of the fundamental diagram parameters of a list of links. The new parameters should be expressed in per-lane units. Use null in place of any of the input parameters to indicate that the current value of the parameter should be kept. The

Parameters:
myScenario - The scenario.
links - List of _Link objects.
freeflowSpeed - Freeflow speed in [mile/hr]
congestionSpeed - Congestion wave speed in [mile/hr]
capacity - Capacity in [veh/hr/lane]
densityJam - Jam density in [veh/mile/lane]
capacityDrop - Capacity drop in [veh/hr/lane]
stdDevCapacity - Standard deviation for the capacity in [veh/hr/lane]
Returns:
_Event object

createEvent_Global_Demand_Knob

public static _Event createEvent_Global_Demand_Knob(_Scenario myScenario,
                                                    double newknob)
Adjust the global demand knob.

The amount of traffic entering the network at a given source equals the nominal profile value multiplied by both the knob for the profile and the global knob. Use this event to make changes to the global demand knob.

Parameters:
myScenario - The scenario.
newknob - New value of the knob.
Returns:
_Event object

createSensor_LoopStation

public static _Sensor createSensor_LoopStation(_Scenario myScenario,
                                               java.lang.String networkId,
                                               java.lang.String linkId)
Create a fixed loop detector station.

This sensor models a loop detector station with loops covering all lanes at a particular location on a link.

Parameters:
myScenario - The scenario.
networkId - The id of the network that contains the link.
linkId - The id of the link where the sensor is placed.
Returns:
_Sensor object

createSensor_Floating

public static _Sensor createSensor_Floating(_Scenario myScenario,
                                            java.lang.String networkId,
                                            java.lang.String linkId)
Create a floating detector.

This sensor models a sensor that moves with the traffic stream. This sensor type can be used to model probe vehicles. The network and link ids in the parameter list correspond to the initial position of the sensor.

Parameters:
myScenario - The scenario.
networkId - The id of the network that contains the link.
linkId - The id of the link where the sensor is placed.
Returns:
XXX
